Your Daily Health Guide
For A Healthy Life

Balanced Diet - A Complete Meal

A daily complete meal of any person shall always contain proper quantity of carbohydrates , protein, fats, vitamins & minerals.

An average Indian adult(â‰ˆ60 kg body weight) with moderate activity may require around 300-360g of carbs, 50-60g of protein and 45-60g of fat per day.
Good sources of carbohydrates may include 3-4 cups of rice or 6-8 chapatis a day
For proteins we have dal, rajma, milk, eggs, fish etc.
For healthy fat sources we have mustard oil, groundnut oil, ghee , fish oils etc.

Plate Distribution

Use the 1/2 - 1/4 - 1/4 rule

A healthy meal should have vegetables , proteins and whole grains to it's core .
50% vegetables & fruits
25% protein
25% whole grains

Meal Timings

A proper time table for intake of previously deided portions shall be made in beforehand

Eat at regular intervals.
Breakfast at 7 a.m.
Lunch at 10:30 a.m.
Healthy snacks at 3:30 p.m.
A good tiffin at 7:30 p.m.
Finally dinner 9:30 p.m.

Maintain Proper Hydration

In your daily proper diet journey, hydration is a vital score.

Drink enough water daily.
If needed maintain a time table for hydration as well.

Lifestyle Habits ( optional )

Physical activity, proper sleep is a major factor in your physiological wellbeing journey.

Do proper physical activity.
Have a good sleep for about 7 hours.
Don't overlook if you are having any stress issue.
